div1.p: D. M. Dull makes final arrangements for a business meeting in Harrisburg with George W. Brewer.

Dear Sir I recd your letter this morning I will meet you in Harrisburg Tomorow Wednesday- I will go to Harrisburg to night and will remain thare to you come down the reason I do not write you in time is I did not receve your letter in time to this morning but I think you will get this in time come down as soon as you get this letter & if I am not in Harrisburg I will leave the papers with my Brother James I Dull thare for you with what instruction I may hav but come down if you can
I fear Truble but Mr MClellance told me that MClure had put collatrul in his hands to pay this money and that he had a judgemet to make him secure
